title: Lady Gaga-Bradley Cooper's 'Shallow' Performance At The Oscars 2019 Was Too Deep For Words!
text:
Somethings are too good to be true and honestly, after watching Lady Gaga and Bradley Cooper perform their hit 'Shallow' at the Oscars 2019 was one such thing. Their chemistry on the stage was so lit that it won't be an exaggeration to say that if I was attending the Oscars, I could have happily left for home after watching them perform!
Twitter
The 'Shallow' Reunion Was Too 'Deep' For Words!
While the audience cheered for her, what came next left everyone speechless! From the way they gazed into each other's eyes to how they drew attention for being effortlessly comfortable on the stage, Gaga and Cooper were a beautiful dream at the Oscars, 2019.
Lady Gaga & Bradley Cooper deliver a show stopping rendition of “Shallow” at the #Oscars. pic.twitter.com/kFhH3KhWMc — Pop Crave (@PopCraveNet) February 25, 2019
Something major just happened. After “Shallow” perf, @ladygaga & Bradley Cooper exited stage for commercial break. During break, they came back to their seats from stage then audience gave them another standing o. I’ve never seen that happen for any performers. Cue embrace#Oscars pic.twitter.com/k9wNh66tn1 — Chris Gardner (@chrissgardner) February 25, 2019
Don't Miss 24.3 K SHARES 17 K SHARES 11.2 K SHARES 9.5 K SHARES 8.9 K SHARES
After thanking her family and co-star and a very close friend Bradley Cooper, Gaga said,
Agencies
Agencies
After watching the video, even you will feel exactly the same.
FULL VIDEO: Lady Gaga & Bradley perform "Shallow" together! #Oscars pic.twitter.com/cRkmQ9oRUu — Lady Gaga Updates (@LGTourNews) February 25, 2019
Finally Lady Gaga is officially an Academy Award winner for best original song and song-writing.
While collecting her award, tears of joy rolled down her cheeks as she hugged Bradley Cooper. She was on the stage stage with co-writers Marc Ronson, Anthony Rossomando and Andrew Wyatt. She said,
“This is hard work. I’ve worked hard for a long time. It’s not about winning -- what it’s about is not giving up. If you have a dream, fight for it. There’s a discipline for passion, and it’s not about how many times you get rejected or you fall down or get beaten up. It’s about how many times you stand up and are brave and keep going.”
"Only because you can't really thank yourself. Lady Gaga, we salute you."
According to a report in people, after the performance, they two met backstage and hugged tightly! “Did I nail it?” asked Gaga. She soon looked at Cooper who comforted her and said,“I’m so f-ing proud of you!”
Well, everyone deserves a friend like Cooper in their lives!
